THE LIBRARY AND INFORMATION SERVICE PROGRAM OF THE PUERTO RICO DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN PUERTO RICO, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) PROVIDING VIRTUAL LIBRARY SERVICES TO PUERTO RICO RESIDENTS OF ALL AGES, TO SUPPORT NEEDS SUCH AS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, LIFELONG LEARNING, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, AND DIGITAL LITERACY SKILLS; 2) PROVIDING LIBRARY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO PUERTO RICANS OF DIVERSE GEOGRAPHIC, CULTURAL, SOCIOECONOMIC BACKGROUNDS, INCLUDING SENIOR CITIZENS, PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES AND TO INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED LITERACY AND INFORMATION SKILLS; AND 3) PROVIDING TRAINING AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO ENHANCE THE SKILLS OF THE CURRENT LIBRARY WORKFORCE AND LEADERSHIP.

WYOMING STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   THE STATE LIBRARY GOALS INCLUDE:  1) RESOURCE SHARING THAT ENSURES ALL STATE RESIDENTS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO INFORMATION RESOURCES TO ASSIST THEM IN THEIR PERSONAL, EDUCATIONAL AND PROFESSIONAL GROWTH; 2) THE STATE LIBRARY WILL CONTINUE AS THE LEADERSHIP AGENCY THAT DESIGNS, FACILITATES AND SUPPORTS EFFICIENCIES, COOPERATIVE PROJECTS AND INFORMATION PRODUCTS THAT ENHANCE AND IMPROVE THE STATEWIDE DEVELOPMENT OF LIBRARIES; AND 3) BUILD CAPACITY FOR LEARNING, CHANGE AND INNOVATION IN THE WYOMING LIBRARY COMMUNITY.

THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC INSTRUCTION- DIVISION FOR LIBRARIES AND TECHNOLOGY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN WISCONSIN, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) ROBUST AND EQUITABLE ACCESS TO TECHNOLOGY THROUGH STATEWIDE INFRASTRUCTURE AND CONSULTING SERVICES; 2) STATEWIDE SHARING OF INFORMATION RESOURCES AND COLLABORATION AMONG LIBRARIES TO PROVIDE EQUITABLE AND EFFICIENT LIBRARY SERVICES FOR ALL WISCONSIN RESIDENTS; 3) INCREASED LEADERSHIP CAPACITY OF PUBLIC LIBRARIES THROUGH LAW, FINANCE AND DATA SUPPORT INCLUDING GOVERNANCE AND SERVICE STANDARDS; 4) STRONGER ENGAGEMENT OF PUBLIC LIBRARIES WITH THEIR COMMUNITIES AND UTILIZATION OF DATA TO ACTIVELY ADAPT TO COMMUNITY NEEDS; AND 5) INCREASED INVOLVEMENT OF YOUTH AND UNDER-REPRESENTED POPULATIONS IN LIBRARY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES THROUGH STAFF TRAINING AND SHELF-READY RESOURCES.

THE WEST VIRGINIA LIBRARY COMMISSION WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN WEST VIRGINIA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS THE WEST VIRGINIA LIBRARY COMMISSION: 1) ADDRESSING THE NEED FOR ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND EDUCATION RESOURCES TO IMPROVE LIFELONG LEARNING FOR ALL WEST VIRGINIANS. THE WVLC WILL STRENGTHEN AND SUPPORT WEST VIRGINIA LIBRARIES BY EXPANDING ACCESS TO INFORMATION, FACILITATING RESOURCE SHARING AMONG LIBRARIES, AND PROVIDING A STRONG TECHNOLOGICAL INFRASTRUCTURE; AND 2) STRENGTHENING AND SUPPORTING WEST VIRGINIA LIBRARIES THROUGH RENEWED FOCUS ON ADVISORY SUPPORT AND CONTINUING EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO HELP LIBRARIES ACHIEVE SUSTAINABLE PROGRESS AND STRENGTHEN THEIR ABILITY TO MEET THE CONTEMPORARY DEMANDS OF THEIR UNIQUE COMMUNITIES.

WASHINGTON STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   THE WASHINGTON STATE LIBRARY WILL 1) CONTRIBUTE TO THE STATE’S ECONOMIC PROSPERITY AND CULTURAL RICHNESS BY SUPPORTING RELEVANT AND HIGH-QUALITY EDUCATION, LITERACY AND READING, AND LIFELONG LEARNING; 2) CONNECT WASHINGTONIANS TO THEIR HISTORY, EMPLOYING DIGITAL INITIATIVES, AND OTHER PRESERVATION STRATEGIES TO TELL THE STORIES OF LOCAL COMMUNITIES AND TO CELEBRATE OUR COMMON HERITAGE; 3) EXPAND THE REACH AND EFFECTIVENESS OF THE WASHINGTON TALKING BOOK AND BRAILLE LIBRARY WITH INNOVATIVE OUTREACH INITIATIVES TO INCREASE OVERALL USER POPULATION, ESTABLISH AND STRENGTHEN BORROWER RELATIONSHIPS, AND PROMOTE HIGH QUALITY, ACCESSIBLE LIBRARY AND INFORMATION RESOURCES; 4) EXPAND AND ENHANCE THE PROVISION OF DIRECT LIBRARY AND INFORMATION SERVICES TO INCARCERATED AND HOSPITALIZED POPULATIONS IN SUPPORT OF EDUCATION, LITERACY, RECOVERY, RECREATION, AND RE-ENTRY; AND 5) ELEVATE THE QUALITY OF LIBRARY SERVICE AND CALIBER OF LIBRARY STAFF THROUGH STATEWIDE PROJECTS, FACILITATION, CONSULTING, GRANTS, TRAINING, AND MODELING BEST PRACTICES TO BUILD CAPACITY IN LIBRARIES STATEWIDE.

THE LIBRARY OF VIRGINIA WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   SPECIFIC STATE GOALS INCLUDE: 1) FOSTER THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE EVOLVING NEIGHBORHOOD/COMMUNITY LIBRARY AS A CENTER FOR LIFELONG LEARNING AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT; 2) FACILITATE ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND THE DISCOVERY OF KNOWLEDGE AND CULTURAL HERITAGE FOR THE PURPOSE OF CULTIVATING AN INFORMED AND ENGAGED COMMUNITY; AND 3) SUPPORT THE TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT OF PROACTIVE LIBRARY LEADERSHIP AND SKILLED STAFF TO MEET THE RAPIDLY CHANGING ENVIRONMENT.

VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF LIBRARIES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   SPECIFIC GOALS INCLUDE: 1) VERMONTERS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO RESOURCES AND AVAILABLE STATEWIDE THROUGH INTERCONNECTED PLATFORMS THAT SHARE CONTENT’/COLLECTIONS ACROSS LIBRARIES; 2) VERMONT LIBRARIES WILL HAVE OPPORTUNITIES TO STRENGTHEN THEIR CAPACITY TO PROVIDE QUALITY SERVICES AND RESOURCES TO ALL CITIZENS; 3) VERMONT LIBRARIES WILL ENHANCE WORKFORCE READINESS PROGRAMS, INCLUDING ENTREPRENEURIAL ENDEAVORS, USING MATERIALS AND SERVICES AVAILABLE THROUGH LIBRARIES; AND 4) VERMONT LIBRARIES WILL BUILD PARTNERSHIPS, PROGRAMS AND SERVICES THAT ENHANCE ACCESS TO EARLY CHILDHOOD AND FAMILY LITERACY, DIGITAL LITERACY, AD LIFELONG LEARNING LIBRARY RESOURCES, PARTICULARLY TO POPULATIONS FACING BARRIERS TO TRADITIONAL LIBRARY SERVICES.

UTAH STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   STATE GOALS INCLUDE: 1) INFORMATION ACCESS – ALL RESIDENTS OF UTAH WILL HAVE ACCESS TO THE QUALITY INFORMATION RESOURCES THEY NEED TO SUCCEED AT SCHOOL, AT WORK, AND IN THEIR DAILY LIVES; 2) INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY – ALL RESIDENTS OF UTAH WILL HAVE CONVENIENT ACCESS TO LIBRARIES AND LIBRARY SERVICES THAT ARE TECHNOLOGICALLY ADVANCED, EFFICIENTLY OPERATED AND STAFFED BY KNOWLEDGEABLE, HELPFUL WORKERS WHO EMPLOY THE BEST PROFESSIONAL PRACTICES; 3) LIFELONG LEARNING – ALL RESIDENTS OF UTAH WILL AND HAVE TO LIBRARY RESOURCES THAT PROMOTE LITERACY, EDUCATION, AND LIFELONG LEARNING AND ENHANCE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, 21ST CENTURY SKILLS, AND DIGITAL LITERACY; AND 4) CIVIC ENGAGEMENT – ALL RESIDENTS OF UTAH WILL EXPAND THEIR INVOLVEMENT I COMMUNITY LIFE AS A RESULT OF PARTICIPATION IN COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS HELD THROUGH THE LIBRARY.

TEXAS STATE LIBRARY AND ARCHIVES COMMISSION WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   STATE GOALS INCLUDE: 1) TEXANS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO SHARED LIBRARY RESOURCES TO MEET THEIR EDUCATIONAL AND INFORMATIONAL NEEDS; 2) TEXANS AND TEXAS COMMUNITIES WILL HAVE ACCESS TO INTERNET CONNECTED RESOURCES AND SERVICES THROUGH TEXAS LIBRARIES TO MEET COMMUNITY AND PERSONAL GOALS AND THE SUPPORT NEEDED TO SUE THE RESOURCES AND SERVICES SUCCESSFULLY; 3) TEXANS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO LIBRARY SERVICES THAT SUPPORT LITERACY AND EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT, ESPECIALLY EARLY CHILDHOOD AND FAMILY LITERACY, DIGITAL LITERACY, AND LIFELONG LEARNING; 4) TEXANS WILL ENHANCE THEIR WORKFORCE READINESS, INCLUDING BUSINESS AND ENTREPRENEURIAL ENDEAVORS, THROUGH USE OF MATERIALS AND SERVICES AT THEIR LIBRARIES; AND 5) TEXANS WILL RECEIVE LIBRARY SERVICES THAT EFFECTIVELY RESPOND TO COMMUNITY NEEDS.

THE TENNESSEE STATE LIBRARY AND ARCHIVES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN TENNESSEE, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS ALL TENNESSEE RESIDENTS: 1) HAVING THE READING SKILLS, INFORMATION RESOURCES, AND LIBRARY SERVICES NEEDED TO SUCCEED IN SCHOOL, AT WORK, AND IN THEIR DAILY LIVES; 2) BEING ABLE TO LOCATE AND ACCESS LIBRARY AND INFORMATION RESOURCES THAT ARE RELEVANT TO THEIR LIVES THROUGH THE PROVISION OF TRADITIONAL READING MATERIALS, NON-PRINT MEDIA, ONLINE AND DOWNLOADABLE RESOURCES, AND ELECTRONIC NETWORKS; AND 3) BENEFITING FROM ENHANCED LIBRARY AND INFORMATION SERVICES BECAUSE LIBRARY STAFF MEMBERS HAVE THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND COMPETENCIES NEEDED TO OFFER HIGH-QUALITY 21ST CENTURY LIBRARY SERVICES.

THE SOUTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). SPECIFIC GOALS INCLUDE: 1A) IMPROVE LIBRARY SERVICES DELIVERED TO SOUTH DAKOTA CITIZENS THROUGH INCREASED PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES RELATED TO THE NINE LSTA PURPOSES, IN COLLABORATION WITH THE SOUTH DAKOTA LIBRARY ASSOCIATION AND OTHERS; 1B) STRENGTHEN THE ABILITY OF LOCAL LIBRARIES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THEIR LOCAL CONSTITUENTS BY PROVIDING RESOURCES AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERTISE THAT SUPPORTS ONE OR MORE OF THE LSTA PURPOSES; 2) COLLECTIONS( PRINT, MEDIA, AND ELECTRONIC) OF THE SOUTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY WILL MEET THE SPECIALIZED NEEDS OF THE STATE’S CITIZENS; 3A) PROMOTE AND ENCOURAGE RESOURCE SHARING; 3B) PROVIDE SERVICES TO VISUALLY/PHYSICALLY IMPAIRED AND READING DISABLED CITIZENS; AND 3C) FACILITATE SHARED PURCHASING OF RESOURCES BY LIBRARIES.

THE SOUTH CAROLINA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).  GOALS INCLUDE: 1) INFORMATION AND LIBRARY SERVICES ARE EXPANDED AND ARE MADE MORE ACCESSIBLE, TAKING ADVANTAGE OF COLLABORATIVE AND PARTNERING OPPORTUNITIES WHENEVER POSSIBLE, AND ARE ALIGNED WITH DOCUMENTED NEEDS OF SOUTH CAROLINIANS; 2) RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING OF LIBRARY STAFF ARE IMPROVED TO INCREASE LEADERSHIP AND SKILLS NEEDED TO BETTER SERVE THE PUBLIC; 3) LIBRARIES PLAY A LARGER ROLE IN CHILDREN’S LIVES, PARTICULARLY CHILDREN AT RISK, AND ESPECIALLY IN REGARD TO READING AND FAMILY LITERACY; 4) ACCESS TO QUALITY LIBRARY SERVICES IN ENHANCED FOR PEOPLE WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY USING A LIBRARY, AND TO UNDERSERVED URBAN AND RURAL COMMUNITIES; 5) LIBRARY SERVICES ARE IMPROVED, THROUGH COLLABORATIVE AND PARTNERING EFFORTS WHENEVER POSSIBLE, FOR PEOPLE OF DIVERSE GEOGRAPHIC, CULTURAL, AND SOCIOECONOMIC BACKGROUNDS FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, AND FOR PEOPLE WITH LIMITED FUNCTIONAL LITERACY; 6) THE TECHNOLOGICAL ENVIRONMENT OF LIBRARIES, INCLUDING LINKAGES BETWEEN LIBRARIES, IS IMPROVED TO ENHANCE ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND SERVICES; AND 7) ALL PEOPLE IN SOUTH CAROLINA HAVE ACCESS TO INFORMATION THROUGH ELECTRONIC RESOURCE SHARING.

THE RHODE ISLAND OFFICE OF LIBRARY AND INFORMATION SERVICES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN RHODE ISLAND, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) PROVIDING ACCESS TO LIBRARY MATERIALS AND INFORMATION RESOURCES THROUGH PHYSICAL AND VIRTUAL SPACES; 2) SUPPORTING THE CONTINUING EDUCATION OF LIBRARIANS, LIBRARY STAFF AND TRUSTEES AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF STATEWIDE PROGRAMMING FOR LIBRARIES; AND 3) EMPOWERING LIBRARIES TO BE INCUBATORS FOR ECONOMIC, EDUCATIONAL AND CULTURAL DEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNITY DISCOURSE.

THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION- OFFICE OF COMMONWEALTH LIBRARIES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN PENNSYLVANIA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) DEVELOPING AND IMPROVING SERVICES AND COLLABORATIONS WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES FOR INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES IN ORDER TO SUPPORT THEIR NEEDS FOR LIFELONG LEARNING AND LITERACY COMPETENCIES IN AREAS SUCH AS BASIC, CIVIC AND SOCIAL, DIGITAL, FINANCIAL, HEALTH, SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING AND MATHEMATICS; 2) INCREASING AND IMPROVING PENNSYLVANIANS' ACCESS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY TO USE AND SHARE DIGITAL LIBRARY SERVICES, RESOURCES AND CONTENT; 3) SUPPORTING AND ENHANCING THE SKILLS OF LIBRARY STAFF AND BOARD LEADERSHIP, ADVANCING THE DELIVERY OF LIBRARY SERVICES, AND IMPROVING PUBLIC LIBRARIES’ ENGAGEMENT WITH LOCAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGH CONTINUING EDUCATION, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND THE PROVISION OF RELEVANT DATA, ANALYTICAL TOOLS AND RESEARCH; 4) DEVELOPING AND IMPROVING SERVICES AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION COLLABORATIONS IN ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES FOR UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS OR FOR PENNSYLVANIANS WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY USING LIBRARIES, ESPECIALLY THOSE LIVING IN POVERTY OR WITH DISABILITIES; AND 5) DEVELOPING AND IMPROVING WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT SERVICES AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION COLLABORATIONS IN ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES FOR INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES.

THE OREGON STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   THE GOALS INCLUDE: 1) PROVIDE ACCESS TO LIBRARY SERVICES, MATERIALS, AND INFORMATION RESOURCES; 2) USE TECHNOLOGY TO INCREASE CAPACITY TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO LIBRARY SERVICES, MATERIALS, AND INFORMATION RESOURCES; 3) PROMOTE EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICE IN LIBRARIES; 4) DEVELOP INFORMATION LITERACY SKILLS; AND 5) FOSTER LIFELONG LEARNING.

THE OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT OF LIBRARIES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   THE DEPARTMENT GOALS INCLUDE: 1) INFORMATION ACCESS – ALL OKLAHOMA RESIDENTS WILL HAVE CONVENIENT ACCESS TO QUALITY INFORMATION RESOURCES IN A FORMAT THAT THEY CAN USE TO ACHIEVE THEIR EDUCATIONAL, OCCUPATIONAL, AND PERSONA;/RECREATIONAL GOALS; 2) INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY – ALL OKLAHOMA RESIDENTS ARE SERVICES BY LOCAL LIBRARIES THAT ARE TECHNOLOGICALLY ADVANCED AND THAT EMPLOY KNOWLEDGEABLE, COMMUNITY-FOCUSED STAFF MEMBERS WHO INCORPORATE THE BEST PROFESSIONAL PRACTICES TO DELIVER HIGH QUALITY LIBRARY SERVICES; 3) LIFELONG LEARNING – ALL OKLAHOMA RESIDENTS HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL, BY ACHIEVING THEIR EDUCATIONAL, OCCUPATIONAL, AND PHYSICAL HEALTH GOALS AND BY PARTICIPATING IN AND CONTRIBUTING TO THE VITALITY OF THEIR COMMUNITIES.

THE STATE LIBRARY OF OHIO WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN OHIO, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) SUPPORTING PROGRAMS AND EXPERIENCES THAT ASSIST LIBRARIES IN PREPARING INDIVIDUALS TO BE ACTIVE LEARNERS AND FULL PARTICIPANTS IN THE LOCAL COMMUNITIES AND THE GLOBAL SOCIETY; 2) PROMOTING LIBRARIES AS STRONG COMMUNITY ANCHORS THAT ENHANCE CIVIC ENGAGEMENT, CULTURAL OPPORTUNITIES AND ECONOMIC VITALITY; 3) SUPPORTING EXEMPLARY STEWARDSHIP OF LIBRARY COLLECTIONS AND PROMOTING THE USE OF TECHNOLOGY TO FACILITATE DISCOVERY OF KNOWLEDGE AND CULTURAL HERITAGE; AND 4) WORKING TO SUSTAIN AND INCREASE ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND IDEAS.

THE NORTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   THE GOALS ARE THAT THE STATE LIBRARY: 1) INFORMATION ACCESS – THE NORTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY ENHANCES ACCESS TO INFORMATION BY PROVIDING LIBRARIES, CITIZENS, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, AND OTHER KEY STAKEHOLDERS WITH ACCESS TO MATERIALS, ELECTRONIC RESOURCES, AND PROFESSIONAL STAFF TO MEET THE INFORMATIONAL NEEDS OF ALL NORTH DAKOTANS; 2) INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY AND SUPPORT – THE NORTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY PROVIDES SERVICES AND RESOURCES TOWARDS ADVANCING AND IMPROVING THE INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY OF THE STATE’S LIBRARY COMMUNITY TO MEET THE DEMANDS OF THE PUBLIC AND SUPPORT THE CONTINUED PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING OF THE STATE’S LIBRARY WORKFORCE; 3) LIFELONG LEARNING – THE NORTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY STRIVES TO ENRICH THE LIVES OF NORTH DAKOTANS BY OFFERING SERVICES AND PROGRAMS THAT SUPPORT AND PROMOTE CONTINUED LIFELONG LEARNING; AND 4) HUMAN SERVICES – THE NORTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY PROVIDES ALL NORTH DAKOTANS WILL ACCESS TO RELEVANT LIBRARY SERVICES, RESOURCES, AND INFORMATION THAT EFFECTIVELY ADDRESSES PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS AND THE CIVIC, CULTURAL, AND ECONOMIC NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITIES.

THE STATE LIBRARY OF NORTH CAROLINA WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN NORTH CAROLINA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) STRENGTHENING CAPACITY, SO THAT NORTH CAROLINIANS WILL HAVE LIBRARIES WITH ESSENTIAL RESOURCES AND CAPABLE STAFF THAT ENABLE THEM TO PROVIDE EXCEPTIONAL LIBRARY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES; 2) EXPANDING ACCESS, SO THAT NORTH CAROLINIANS WILL HAVE EXPANDED ACCESS TO RESOURCES FOR LEARNING AND SUCCESS IN SCHOOL, WORK, AND LIFE; AND 3) COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, SO THAT NORTH CAROLINIANS WILL HAVE LIBRARIES THAT COOPERATE, COORDINATE, COLLABORATE, AND COMMUNICATE TO HELP THE COMMUNITY ADDRESS ITS NEEDS.

THE DEPARTMENT OF CULTURAL AFFAIRS- NEW MEXICO STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN NEW MEXICO, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) EXPANDING SERVICES FOR LEARNING AND ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES, IN ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES FOR INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES IN ORDER TO SUPPORT SUCH INDIVIDUALS' NEEDS FOR EDUCATION, LIFELONG LEARNING, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, AND DIGITAL LITERACY SKILLS; 2) ESTABLISHING OR ENHANCING INTERLIBRARY RESOURCE SHARING ELECTRONICALLY VIA ILLIAD AND IMPROVE COORDINATION AMONG AND BETWEEN LIBRARIES IN NEW MEXICO FOR THE PURPOSE OF IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF AND ACCESS TO LIBRARY INFORMATION SERVICES; AND 3) PROVIDING LIBRARY SERVICES TO VISUALLY IMPAIRED, RURAL, HOMEBOUND, AND UNDERSERVED NEW MEXICO RESIDENTS.

THE THOMAS EDISON STATE UNIVERSITY- NEW JERSEY STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN NEW JERSEY, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS ALL NEW JERSEY RESIDENTS: 1) HAVING CONVENIENT ACCESS TO QUALITY INFORMATION RESOURCES IN A FORMAT THAT THEY CAN USE TO ACHIEVE THEIR EDUCATIONAL, OCCUPATIONAL, AND PERSONAL/RECREATIONAL GOALS; 2) BEING SERVED BY LOCAL LIBRARIES THAT ARE TECHNOLOGICALLY ADVANCED AND THAT EMPLOY KNOWLEDGEABLE, COMMUNITY-FOCUSED STAFF MEMBERS WHO INCORPORATE THE BEST PROFESSIONAL PRACTICES TO DELIVER HIGH QUALITY LIBRARY SERVICES; AND 3) HAVING AN OPPORTUNITY TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AND TO PARTICIPATE IN AND CONTRIBUTE TO THEIR COMMUNITIES.

THE NEW HAMPSHIRE STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN NEW HAMPSHIRE, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) INCREASING THE EQUITY OF ACCESS TO LIBRARY AND INFORMATION SERVICES FOR NEW HAMPSHIRE RESIDENTS OF ALL ABILITIES AND BACKGROUNDS BY PROVIDING RESOURCE SHARING, ELECTRONIC RESOURCES, AND CONTINUING ACCESS TO HISTORIC MATERIALS THROUGH DIRECT SERVICES AS WELL AS COORDINATION OF LINKAGES AMONG AND BETWEEN LIBRARIES AND PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS; 2) INCREASING THE EQUITY OF SERVICE TO NEW HAMPSHIRE RESIDENTS BY PROVIDING PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT RESOURCES AND OPPORTUNITIES TO LIBRARIANS THROUGHOUT THE STATE SO THAT THEY CAN LEARN ABOUT BEST PRACTICES AND LIBRARY INITIATIVES THAT WILL HELP THEM BETTER SERVE THEIR CONSTITUENTS, ESPECIALLY CHILDREN, OLDER RESIDENTS, AND RURAL POPULATIONS; AND 3) INSPIRING LIFELONG LEARNING AND ADVANCING THE EQUITY OF INNOVATIVE SERVICES AND PROGRAMMING BY DEVELOPING PROJECTS FOR USE BY THE STATE’S LIBRARIES, INCLUDING SCALABLE PILOT PROJECTS, TO ANTICIPATE AND MEET THE CHANGING NEEDS OF NEW HAMPSHIRE’S RESIDENTS FOR LIBRARY SERVICES AND INFORMATION.

NEVADA STATE LIBRARY AND ARCHIVES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). STATE GOALS INCLUDE: 1) STRENGTHEN NEVADA LIBRARIES; ABILITY TO EFFECTIVELY RESPOND TO COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH TRAINING, PLANNING, AND ASSESSMENT; 2) ENCOURAGE NEVADA LIBRARIES TO DEVELOP AND USE PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATION TO MAXIMIZE USER RESOURCES AND SERVICES THROUGHOUT THE STATE; 3) NEVADA LIBRARIES WILL PROVIDE RESPONSIVE AND ACCESSIBLE LEARNING ENVIRONMENTS THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF ALL NEVADA RESIDENTS; AND 4) BUILD CAPACITY OF LIBRARIES TO MEET EVOLVING INFORMATION ACCESS NEEDS.

THE NEBRASKA LIBRARY COMMISSION WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).  THE GOALS OF THE COMMISSION INCLUDE: 1) ALL NEBRASKANS WILL BENEFIT FROM LIFELONG LEARNING AND CULTURAL ENRICHMENT DELIVERED THROUGH THEIR LIBRARY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES; 2) LIBRARY STAFF AND SUPPORTERS WILL HAVE THE TOOLS AND SKILLS TO PROVIDE AND SUSTAIN NEEDED PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO THEIR TARGET AUDIENCES; AND 3) THE NEBRASKA LIBRARY COMMISSION PROMOTES LIBRARY SERVICES STATEWIDE AND COLLABORATES WITH LIBRARIES TO EFFECTIVELY MARKET THEIR PROGRAMS, THEIR SERVICES, AND THEIR VALUE TO THE COMMUNITY.

THE MONTANA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN MONTANA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) THE MONTANA STATE LIBRARY ENCOURAGING, PLANNING, IMPLEMENTING, AND SUPPORTING LIBRARIES WITH COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS; 2) THE MONTANA LIBRARY COMMUNITY SPEAKING IN A WAY THAT REVEALS ITS INTERCONNECTEDNESS AND ESTABLISHES A COHESIVE “MONTANA LIBRARY” IDENTITY THAT HELPS COMMUNITY MEMBERS UNDERSTAND THAT LIBRARIES ARE FOR THEIR LIVES RIGHT NOW AS WELL AS FOR THEIR LIFETIMES; 3) LIBRARIANS, ADVISORY MEMBERS, AND BOARD MEMBERS LISTENING TO THEIR COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO DESIGN LIBRARY SERVICES THAT MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE COMMUNITY WHILE CONTINUING TO BRIDGE DIGITAL/TRADITIONAL LIBRARY SERVICES; 4) EVERY MONTANAN HAVING ACCESS TO THE INTERNET; AND 5) LIBRARY COMMUNITY HAVING ADEQUATE AND STABLE SUPPORT TO PROVIDE THE BEST LIBRARY SERVICE POSSIBLE.

THE MISSISSIPPI LIBRARY COMMISSION WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN MISSISSIPPI, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) ENHANCING THE TECHNOLOGICAL ENVIRONMENT OF MISSISSIPPI LIBRARIES; 2) SUPPORTING AND ENHANCING THE LIBRARY WORKFORCE; 3) STRENGTHENING LIBRARIES BY SHARING RESOURCES; 4) SERVING ALL MISSISSIPPIANS; AND 5) EMPOWERING LIBRARIES.

THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION- STATE LIBRARY SERVICES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN MINNESOTA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) LIBRARY SERVICES AND POLICIES PROMOTING BARRIER-FREE ACCESS; 2) LIBRARIES CONTRIBUTING TO THE WORLD'S BEST WORKFORCE; 3) LIBRARIES RESPONDING TO DIVERSE COMMUNITY NEEDS; 4) LIBRARY VALUE BEING MEASURED AND DEMONSTRATED; AND 5) LIBRARIES FACILITATING DIGITAL EQUITY AND LITERACY.

THE LIBRARY OF MICHIGAN WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN MICHIGAN, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) PROVIDING MICHIGAN RESIDENTS WITH EQUAL ACCESS TO INFORMATION RESOURCES IN VARIOUS FORMATS FOR LIFELONG LEARNING; 2) OFFERING MICHIGAN RESIDENTS ACCESS TO CURRENT SERVICES AND TRAINING SUPPORT THROUGH THEIR LIBRARIES; 3) OFFERING SUPPORT TO COMMUNITIES THROUGH COLLECTIVE IMPACT INITIATIVES AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT; AND 4) PROVIDING RESIDENTS WITH MICHIGAN’S HISTORICAL AND CULTURAL COLLECTIONS FOR LIFELONG LEARNING.

THE MASSACHUSETTS BOARD OF LIBRARY COMMISSIONERS WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). THE COMMISSION’S GOALS ARE TO: 1) PROMOTE LEARNING; 2) ENABLING ACCESS; 3) STRENGTHENING LIBRARIES; 4) BUILDING THE WORKFORCE; 5) DEVELOPING SKILLS; AND 6) CONNECTING COMMUNITIES.

THE MARYLAND STATE LIBRARY AGENCY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN MARYLAND, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) STRENGTHENING LIBRARIES’ INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY THROUGH COLLABORATIVE CONTINUING EDUCATION AND STAFF DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES; 2) HELPING LIBRARIES IMPROVE ACCESS TO INFORMATION FOR THEIR USERS; 3) HELPING LIBRARIES DEVELOP LIFELONG LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE USERS’ FORMAL EDUCATION AND GENERAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS; AND 4) HELPING LIBRARIES FOSTER ECONOMIC AND EMPLOYMENT DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN ORDER TO FACILITATE JOB GROWTH IN MARYLAND.

THE STATE LIBRARY OF LOUISIANA WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN LOUISIANA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) DEVELOPING A COMPETENT, LITERATE AND KNOWLEDGEABLE CITIZENRY THAT CAN BENEFIT FROM INCREASED EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND A LIFELONG LOVE OF READING AND LEARNING; 2) ENCOURAGING DIGITAL AND INFORMATION LITERACY AMONG THE GENERAL POPULATION AND FACILITATING LOUISIANA RESIDENTS IN TAKING ADVANTAGE OF ALL BENEFITS OF TECHNOLOGY, THUS DECREASING THE DIGITAL DIVIDE; AND 3) INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF LOUISIANA LIBRARIES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND TO MAKE THE PUBLIC LIBRARY THE CENTER FOR CIVIC ENGAGEMENT.

THE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT FOR LIBRARIES AND ARCHIVES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). THE STATE GOALS INCLUDE: 1) MEET THE INFORMATION NEEDS OF KENTUCKY CITIZENS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO RESOURCES AND PUBLIC RECORDS; 2) IMPROVE THE INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY OF LIBRARIES AND ARCHIVES THROUGH STAFF DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES; AND 3) AID LIBRARIES IN IMPROVING SERVICES TO KENTUCKY RESIDENTS INCLUDING SERVICES THAT SUPPORT LIFELONG LEARNING, EMPLOYMENT, EARLY LITERACY AND YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT.

THE STATE LIBRARY OF KANSAS WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IT’S GOALS INCLUDE: 1) THE STATE LIBRARY WILL CONTINUE AS THE LEADERSHIP AGENCY THAT DESIGNS, FACILITATES AND SUPPORTS EFFICIENCIES, COOPERATIVE PROJECTS AND INFORMATION PRODUCTS TO ENSURE ROBUST RESOURCES AND ACCESS FOR ALL STATE RESIDENTS; 2) THE STATE LIBRARY WILL CONTINUE PROVIDING A COMPREHENSIVE STATEWIDE RESOURCE SHARING PLATFORM TO ENSURE THAT ALL STATE RESIDENTS HAVE ACCESS TO INFORMATION RESOURCES TO ASSIST THEM IN THEIR PERSONAL, EDUCATIONAL AND PROFESSIONAL GROWTH; AND 3) ASSIST LIBRARIANS ACROSS THE STATE TO ADAPT LIBRARY SERVICES TO 21ST CENTURY NEEDS WHILE CONTINUING TO PROVIDE TRADITIONAL LIBRARY SERVICES.

THE STATE LIBRARY OF IOWA WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN IOWA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS ALL IOWANS 1) HAVING ACCESS TO QUALITY INFORMATION RESOURCES AND THE ASSISTANCE NEEDED TO SELECT AND USE THE INFORMATION TO SUCCEED PERSONALLY, PROFESSIONALLY, AND ACADEMICALLY; 2) BEING SERVED BY EXCELLENT LOCAL LIBRARIES THAT ARE TECHNOLOGICALLY ADVANCED AND THAT EMPLOY KNOWLEDGEABLE AND COMMUNITY FOCUSED STAFF WHO INCORPORATE THE BEST PROFESSIONAL PRACTICES TO DELIVER HIGH QUALITY LIBRARY SERVICES; AND 3) LEARNING TO BE PRODUCTIVE 21ST CENTURY CITIZENS.

THE INDIANA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN INDIANA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) PROVIDING UP-TO-DATE, RELIABLE ACCESS TO INFORMATION TO MEET THE NEEDS OF ALL INDIANA RESIDENTS BY UTILIZING EFFECTIVE TELECOMMUNICATIONS, TECHNOLOGY AND RESOURCES; 2) IMPROVING THE CAPACITY OF LIBRARIES THROUGH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND LEADERSHIP TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES AND GRANTS FOR TECHNOLOGY; AND 3) AIDING LIBRARIES IN IMPROVING SERVICES TO INDIANA RESIDENTS, INCLUDING SERVICES THAT SUPPORT LIFELONG LEARNING AND HUMAN SERVICES.

THE ILLINOIS STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). STATE GOALS INCLUDE POSITIONING THE ILLINOIS LIBRARY COMMUNITY: 1) POSITION THE ILLINOIS LIBRARY COMMUNITY TO EXTEND LIBRARY SERVICES FOR ALL ILLINOIS RESIDENTS BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND IDEAS; 2) POSITION THE ILLINOIS LIBRARY COMMUNITY AS AN EDUCATIONAL ANCHOR BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO SUPPORT EDUCATION, INFORMATION FLUENCY AND LIFELONG LEARNING; AND 3) POSITION THE ILLINOIS LIBRARY COMMUNITY TO FURTHER A LITERATE ILLINOIS BY CREATING A CULTURE THAT ENCOURAGES READING.

THE IDAHO COMMISSION FOR LIBRARIES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN IDAHO, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) BUILDING THE INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY OF LIBRARIES TO BETTER SERVE THEIR COMMUNITIES; 2) SUPPORTING THE ROLE OF LIBRARIES IN PREPARING IDAHOANS TO BE COLLEGE AND CAREER READY; 3) ENSURING EQUITABLE ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND LIBRARY SERVICES FOR IDAHOANS WITH DISABILITIES, THOSE IN RURAL COMMUNITIES, ENGLISH-LANGUAGE LEARNERS, PEOPLE LIVING IN POVERTY, AND OTHER UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES; AND 4) SUPPORTING THE ROLE OF LIBRARIES IN ECONOMIC AND EMPLOYMENT DEVELOPMENT.

THE HAWAII STATE PUBLIC LIBRARY SYSTEM WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN HAWAII, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) ROBUST TECHNOLOGICAL INFRASTRUCTURE; 2) 24/7 VIRTUAL COLLECTIONS; 3) LIFELONG LEARNING; 4) INNOVATIVE DEVELOPMENT TO SUPPORT IMPROVED SERVICES AND PROGRAMS; AND 5) AN EDUCATED LIBRARY WORKFORCE THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF STAFF COMPETENCIES, TRAINING INFRASTRUCTURE, AND SUPPORT FOR LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES.

THE GEORGIA PUBLIC LIBRARY SERVICE WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). STATE GOALS INCLUDE: 1) SERVE AS TRUSTED ADVISERS TO THE LIBRARY COMMUNITY; 2) DEVELOP A SUPPORTIVE COMMUNITY FOR GEORGIA’S PUBLIC LIBRARIES; 3) ENSURE EQUAL ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND TECHNOLOGY; AND 4) FOSTER A CULTURE OF LEARNING STATEWIDE.

THE STATE LIBRARY AND ARCHIVES OF FLORIDA WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). SPECIFIC GOALS INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: 1) SERVICES: FLORIDIANS USE INFORMATION AND INNOVATIVE AND RESPONSIVE SERVICES FROM ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES AND ARCHIVES THAT MEET DIVERSE INFORMATION NEEDS AND 2) STRENGTHEN LIBRARIES: FLORIDIANS USE LIBRARIES WITH STAFF, RESOURCES, AND FACILITIES THAT TRANSFORM TO MEET USER NEEDS.

THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA PUBLIC LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) ENABLING DISTRICT RESIDENTS TO HAVE THE READING SKILLS, INFORMATION RESOURCES, AND LIBRARY SERVICES THEY NEED TO SUCCEED; 2) PROVIDING ACCESS TO RELEVANT LIBRARY AND INFORMATION SERVICES AND RESOURCES; 3) FACILITATING KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES THAT ALLOW LIBRARY STAFF TO OFFER HIGH QUALITY SERVICES; 4) SUPPORTING DISTRICT RESIDENTS IN ACQUIRING PRODUCTIVE AND FULFILLING EMPLOYMENT; AND 5) ENGAGING DISTRICT RESIDENTS IN COMMUNITY LIFE THROUGH THEIR PARTICIPATION IN LIBRARY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES.

THE DELAWARE DIVISION OF LIBRARIES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN DELAWARE, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) BEING SERVED BY ONLINE SERVICES AND LOCAL LIBRARIES THAT ARE TECHNOLOGICALLY ADVANCED AND EMPLOY KNOWLEDGEABLE AND COMMUNITY-FOCUSED STAFF MEMBERS WHO INCORPORATE THE BEST PROFESSIONAL PRACTICES TO DELIVER HIGH QUALITY LIBRARY SERVICES; 2) HAVING CONVENIENT ACCESS TO THE QUALITY INFORMATION RESOURCES THEY NEED TO SUCCEED IN SCHOOL AND AT WORK AND TO FULFILL THEIR PERSONAL GOALS; AND 3) DELAWAREANS REACHING THEIR FULL POTENTIAL IN THE 21ST CENTURY.

THE CONNECTICUT STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN CONNECTICUT, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) SUPPORTING THE IMPACT OF LIBRARIES AS COMMUNITY ANCHORS WITH INCREASED INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY, COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, AND PROGRAMMING FOCUSED ON THE SEVEN LITERACIES; AND 2) IMPROVING ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND LIBRARY RESOURCES FOR ALL RESIDENTS OF THE STATE.

THE COLORADO STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). SPECIFIC GOALS INCLUDE: 1) ALL COLORADO RESIDENTS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO LIBRARY SERVICES THAT SUPPORT FORMAL EDUCATIONAL ACHIEVEMENT AND INSPIRE LIFELONG LEARNING; 2) COLORADO LIBRARIES WILL SHARE RESOURCES, EXPERTISE, AND SYSTEMS STATEWIDE TO ENSURE THE EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVE DELIVERY OF LIBRARY SERVICES TO THEIR DIVERSE COMMUNITIES; 3) COLORADO LIBRARY STAFF AND LEADERSHIP WILL CONTINUOUSLY ENHANCE THEIR SKILLS, ADVANCING LIBRARY SERVICES TO COLORADO RESIDENTS; AND 4) UNDERSERVED COLORADO RESIDENTS WILL RECEIVE SERVICES FROM COLORADO LIBRARIES THAT MEET THEIR INDIVIDUAL NEEDS.

THE CALIFORNIA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN CALIFORNIA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) PROVIDING EQUITABLE ACCESS TO INFORMATION, SERVICES, AND RESOURCES IN A TRUSTED COMMUNITY SPACE; 2) DELIVERING ESSENTIAL LITERACY SERVICES AND PROVIDING LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES; 3) INSPIRING INNOVATION, CREATIVITY, CONNECTIONS, AND COLLABORATION; 4) HAVING THE TECHNOLOGY TO DELIVER INFORMATION AND SERVICES IN THE WAYS COMMUNITIES EXPECT AND NEED; 5) CONTRIBUTING TO ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND WORKFORCE INNOVATION; 6) CONNECTING CALIFORNIANS TO THEIR HISTORY AND CULTURE; AND 7) ENGAGING IN CONTINUING EDUCATION AND LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES.

THE ARKANSAS STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN ARKANSAS, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) ENHANCING ACCESS TO INFORMATION; 2) PROVIDING TRAINING AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TO THE STATE'S LIBRARY WORKFORCE; 3) PROVIDING PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO TARGETED AUDIENCES; AND 4) ENHANCING THE TECHNOLOGICAL ENVIRONMENT OF ARKANSAS LIBRARIES.

THE ARIZONA STATE LIBRARY, ARCHIVES AND PUBLIC RECORDS WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN ARIZONA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) INFORMATION ACCESS FOR ARIZONA’S RESIDENTS; 2) INFORMAL EDUCATION FOR RESIDENTS OF ALL AGES; 3) LIBRARIES THAT ENABLE RESIDENTS TO ENGAGE WITH THEIR COMMUNITIES, DEVELOP WORKFORCE SKILLS, AND LEARN LIFE LITERACIES SUCH AS PARENTING, HEALTH AND FINANCE; AND 4) IMPROVEMENTS TO LIBRARY TECHNOLOGY RESOURCES, STAFF SKILLS, PROGRAMS, AND COLLECTIONS.

THE ALASKA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN ALASKA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) SUPPORTING LIFELONG LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL ALASKANS; 2) PROVIDING ACCESS TO CONTENT AND MATERIALS IN VARIOUS FORMATS FOR ALL ALASKANS; AND 3) EXPLORING EVOLVING ROLES AS ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS THAT BENEFIT THEIR COMMUNITIES.

THE ALABAMA PUBLIC LIBRARY SERVICE WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN PENNSYLVANIA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) DEVELOPING AND IMPROVING SERVICES AND COLLABORATIONS WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES FOR INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES IN ORDER TO SUPPORT THEIR NEEDS FOR LIFELONG LEARNING AND LITERACY COMPETENCIES IN AREAS SUCH AS BASIC, CIVIC AND SOCIAL, DIGITAL, FINANCIAL, HEALTH, SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING AND MATHEMATICS 2) INCREASING AND IMPROVING PENNSYLVANIANS' ACCESS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY TO USE AND SHARE DIGITAL LIBRARY SERVICES, RESOURCES AND CONTENT 3) SUPPORTING AND ENHANCING THE SKILLS OF LIBRARY STAFF AND BOARD LEADERSHIP, ADVANCING THE DELIVERY OF LIBRARY SERVICES, AND IMPROVING PUBLIC LIBRARIES ENGAGEMENT WITH LOCAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGH CONTINUING EDUCATION, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND THE PROVISION OF RELEVANT DATA, ANALYTICAL TOOLS AND RESEARCH 4) DEVELOPING AND IMPROVING SERVICES AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION COLLABORATIONS IN ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES FOR UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS OR FOR PENNSYLVANIANS WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY USING LIBRARIES, ESPECIALLY THOSE LIVING IN POVERTY OR WITH DISABILITIES AND 5) DEVELOPING AND IMPROVING WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT SERVICES AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION COLLABORATIONS IN ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES FOR INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES.

WYOMING STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).&NBSP;&NBSP; THE STATE LIBRARY GOALS INCLUDE:&NBSP; 1) RESOURCE SHARING THAT ENSURES ALL STATE RESIDENTS WILL HAVE ACCESS TO INFORMATION RESOURCES TO ASSIST THEM IN THEIR PERSONAL, EDUCATIONAL AND PROFESSIONAL GROWTH; 2) THE STATE LIBRARY WILL CONTINUE AS THE LEADERSHIP AGENCY THAT DESIGNS, FACILITATES AND SUPPORTS EFFICIENCIES, COOPERATIVE PROJECTS AND INFORMATION PRODUCTS THAT ENHANCE AND IMPROVE THE STATEWIDE DEVELOPMENT OF LIBRARIES; AND 3) BUILD CAPACITY FOR LEARNING, CHANGE AND INNOVATION IN THE WYOMING LIBRARY COMMUNITY.

THE OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT OF LIBRARIES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   THE DEPARTMENT GOALS INCLUDE: 1) INFORMATION ACCESS ? ALL OKLAHOMA RESIDENTS WILL HAVE CONVENIENT ACCESS TO QUALITY INFORMATION RESOURCES IN A FORMAT THAT THEY CAN USE TO ACHIEVE THEIR EDUCATIONAL, OCCUPATIONAL, AND PERSONA;/RECREATIONAL GOALS; 2) INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY ? ALL OKLAHOMA RESIDENTS ARE SERVICES BY LOCAL LIBRARIES THAT ARE TECHNOLOGICALLY ADVANCED AND THAT EMPLOY KNOWLEDGEABLE, COMMUNITY-FOCUSED STAFF MEMBERS WHO INCORPORATE THE BEST PROFESSIONAL PRACTICES TO DELIVER HIGH QUALITY LIBRARY SERVICES; 3) LIFELONG LEARNING ? ALL OKLAHOMA RESIDENTS HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL, BY ACHIEVING THEIR EDUCATIONAL, OCCUPATIONAL, AND PHYSICAL HEALTH GOALS AND BY PARTICIPATING IN AND CONTRIBUTING TO THE VITALITY OF THEIR COMMUNITIES.

THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION- OFFICE OF COMMONWEALTH LIBRARIES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN PENNSYLVANIA, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) DEVELOPING AND IMPROVING SERVICES AND COLLABORATIONS WITH COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS IN ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES FOR INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES IN ORDER TO SUPPORT THEIR NEEDS FOR LIFELONG LEARNING AND LITERACY COMPETENCIES IN AREAS SUCH AS BASIC, CIVIC AND SOCIAL, DIGITAL, FINANCIAL, HEALTH, SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING AND MATHEMATICS; 2) INCREASING AND IMPROVING PENNSYLVANIANS' ACCESS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY TO USE AND SHARE DIGITAL LIBRARY SERVICES, RESOURCES AND CONTENT; 3) SUPPORTING AND ENHANCING THE SKILLS OF LIBRARY STAFF AND BOARD LEADERSHIP, ADVANCING THE DELIVERY OF LIBRARY SERVICES, AND IMPROVING PUBLIC LIBRARIES? ENGAGEMENT WITH LOCAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGH CONTINUING EDUCATION, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND THE PROVISION OF RELEVANT DATA, ANALYTICAL TOOLS AND RESEARCH; 4) DEVELOPING AND IMPROVING SERVICES AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION COLLABORATIONS IN ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES FOR UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS OR FOR PENNSYLVANIANS WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY USING LIBRARIES, ESPECIALLY THOSE LIVING IN POVERTY OR WITH DISABILITIES; AND 5) DEVELOPING AND IMPROVING WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT SERVICES AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION COLLABORATIONS IN ALL TYPES OF LIBRARIES FOR INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES.&NBSP;

THE NORTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).   THE GOALS ARE THAT THE STATE LIBRARY: 1) INFORMATION ACCESS ? THE NORTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY ENHANCES ACCESS TO INFORMATION BY PROVIDING LIBRARIES, CITIZENS, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, AND OTHER KEY STAKEHOLDERS WITH ACCESS TO MATERIALS, ELECTRONIC RESOURCES, AND PROFESSIONAL STAFF TO MEET THE INFORMATIONAL NEEDS OF ALL NORTH DAKOTANS; 2) INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY AND SUPPORT ? THE NORTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY PROVIDES SERVICES AND RESOURCES TOWARDS ADVANCING AND IMPROVING THE INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY OF THE STATE?S LIBRARY COMMUNITY TO MEET THE DEMANDS OF THE PUBLIC AND SUPPORT THE CONTINUED PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING OF THE STATE?S LIBRARY WORKFORCE; 3) LIFELONG LEARNING ? THE NORTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY STRIVES TO ENRICH THE LIVES OF NORTH DAKOTANS BY OFFERING SERVICES AND PROGRAMS THAT SUPPORT AND PROMOTE CONTINUED LIFELONG LEARNING; AND 4) HUMAN SERVICES ? THE NORTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY PROVIDES ALL NORTH DAKOTANS WILL ACCESS TO RELEVANT LIBRARY SERVICES, RESOURCES, AND INFORMATION THAT EFFECTIVELY ADDRESSES PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS AND THE CIVIC, CULTURAL, AND ECONOMIC NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITIES.

THE SOUTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). SPECIFIC GOALS INCLUDE: 1A) IMPROVE LIBRARY SERVICES DELIVERED TO SOUTH DAKOTA CITIZENS THROUGH INCREASED PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES RELATED TO THE NINE LSTA PURPOSES, IN COLLABORATION WITH THE SOUTH DAKOTA LIBRARY ASSOCIATION AND OTHERS; 1B) STRENGTHEN THE ABILITY OF LOCAL LIBRARIES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THEIR LOCAL CONSTITUENTS BY PROVIDING RESOURCES AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERTISE THAT SUPPORTS ONE OR MORE OF THE LSTA PURPOSES; 2) COLLECTIONS( PRINT, MEDIA, AND ELECTRONIC) OF THE SOUTH DAKOTA STATE LIBRARY WILL MEET THE SPECIALIZED NEEDS OF THE STATE?S CITIZENS; 3A) PROMOTE AND ENCOURAGE RESOURCE SHARING; 3B) PROVIDE SERVICES TO VISUALLY/PHYSICALLY IMPAIRED AND READING DISABLED CITIZENS; AND 3C) FACILITATE SHARED PURCHASING OF RESOURCES BY LIBRARIES.

THE NEW YORK STATE EDUCATION DEPARTMENT- NEW YORK STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN NEW YORK, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) HAVING IMPROVED ACCESS TO LIBRARY RESOURCES THAT ADVANCE AND ENHANCE THEIR PERSONAL, EDUCATIONAL AND WORKING LIVES; 2) DELIVERING NEW AND IMPROVED LIBRARY PROGRAMS THAT ANTICIPATE AND MEET NEW YORKER'S CONSTANTLY CHANGING NEEDS FOR LIBRARY SERVICES; 3) NEW YORKERS OF ALL AGES PERCEIVING LIBRARIES AS COMMUNITY LEARNING SPACES OFFERING HIGH-QUALITY LIFELONG LEARNING, LITERACY AND KNOWLEDGE CREATION OPPORTUNITIES THAT ENHANCE CIVIC ENGAGEMENT AND ECONOMIC VITALITY; AND 4) ALL NEW YORKERS BENEFITING FROM STATEWIDE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES OF THE NEW YORK STATE LIBRARY THAT EFFECTIVELY LEVERAGE PRIVATE AND PUBLIC FUNDING THROUGH COLLABORATION AND PARTNERSHIPS AND MAXIMIZE VALUE IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE GOALS ONE, TWO AND THREE.&NBSP;

THE SOUTH CAROLINA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA).&NBSP; GOALS INCLUDE: 1) INFORMATION AND LIBRARY SERVICES ARE EXPANDED AND ARE MADE MORE ACCESSIBLE, TAKING ADVANTAGE OF COLLABORATIVE AND PARTNERING OPPORTUNITIES WHENEVER POSSIBLE, AND ARE ALIGNED WITH DOCUMENTED NEEDS OF SOUTH CAROLINIANS; 2) RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING OF LIBRARY STAFF ARE IMPROVED TO INCREASE LEADERSHIP AND SKILLS NEEDED TO BETTER SERVE THE PUBLIC; 3) LIBRARIES PLAY A LARGER ROLE IN CHILDREN?S LIVES, PARTICULARLY CHILDREN AT RISK, AND ESPECIALLY IN REGARD TO READING AND FAMILY LITERACY; 4) ACCESS TO QUALITY LIBRARY SERVICES IN ENHANCED FOR PEOPLE WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY USING A LIBRARY, AND TO UNDERSERVED URBAN AND RURAL COMMUNITIES; 5) LIBRARY SERVICES ARE IMPROVED, THROUGH COLLABORATIVE AND PARTNERING EFFORTS WHENEVER POSSIBLE, FOR PEOPLE OF DIVERSE GEOGRAPHIC, CULTURAL, AND SOCIOECONOMIC BACKGROUNDS FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, AND FOR PEOPLE WITH LIMITED FUNCTIONAL LITERACY; 6) THE TECHNOLOGICAL ENVIRONMENT OF LIBRARIES, INCLUDING LINKAGES BETWEEN LIBRARIES, IS IMPROVED TO ENHANCE ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND SERVICES; AND 7) ALL PEOPLE IN SOUTH CAROLINA HAVE ACCESS TO INFORMATION THROUGH ELECTRONIC RESOURCE SHARING.

THE DEPARTMENT OF CULTURAL AFFAIRS- NEW MEXICO STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). NEVADA STATE LIBRARY AND ARCHIVES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). THE MONTANA STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IDENTITY THAT HELPS COMMUNITY MEMBERS UNDERSTAND THAT LIBRARIES ARE FOR THEIR LIVES RIGHT NOW AS WELL AS FOR THEIR LIFETIMES; 3) LIBRARIANS, ADVISORY MEMBERS, AND BOARD MEMBERS LISTENING TO THEIR COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO DESIGN LIBRARY SERVICES THAT MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN THE COMMUNITY WHILE CONTINUING TO BRIDGE DIGITAL/TRADITIONAL LIBRARY SERVICES; 4) EVERY MONTANAN HAVING ACCESS TO THE INTERNET; AND 5) LIBRARY COMMUNITY HAVING ADEQUATE AND STABLE SUPPORT TO PROVIDE THE BEST LIBRARY SERVICE POSSIBLE.&NBSP;

THE NEBRASKA LIBRARY COMMISSION WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). THE MISSOURI STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). THE THOMAS EDISON STATE UNIVERSITY- NEW JERSEY STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN NEW JERSEY, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS ALL NEW JERSEY RESIDENTS: 1) HAVING CONVENIENT ACCESS TO QUALITY INFORMATION RESOURCES IN A FORMAT THAT THEY CAN USE TO ACHIEVE THEIR EDUCATIONAL, OCCUPATIONAL, AND PERSONAL/RECREATIONAL GOALS; 2) BEING SERVED BY LOCAL LIBRARIES THAT ARE TECHNOLOGICALLY ADVANCED AND THAT EMPLOY KNOWLEDGEABLE, COMMUNITY-FOCUSED STAFF MEMBERS WHO INCORPORATE THE BEST PROFESSIONAL PRACTICES TO DELIVER HIGH QUALITY LIBRARY SERVICES; AND 3) HAVING AN OPPORTUNITY TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AND TO PARTICIPATE IN AND CONTRIBUTE TO THEIR COMMUNITIES.

THE MISSISSIPPI LIBRARY COMMISSION WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). THE STATE LIBRARY OF KANSAS WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). THE DIVISION OF LIBRARIES, ARCHIVES AND MUSEUMS OF THE VIRGIN ISLANDS DEPARTMENT OF PLANNING AND NATURAL RESOURCES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). THE NEW HAMPSHIRE STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION- STATE LIBRARY SERVICES WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). THE ILLINOIS STATE LIBRARY WILL USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE GOALS OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR FY 2018-2022, WHICH REFLECT THE PURPOSES AND PRIORITIES OF THE LIBRARY SERVICES AND TECHNOLOGY ACT (LSTA). IN MICHIGAN, SPECIFIC GOALS ADDRESS 1) PROVIDING MICHIGAN RESIDENTS WITH EQUAL ACCESS TO INFORMATION RESOURCES IN VARIOUS FORMATS FOR LIFELONG LEARNING; 2) OFFERING MICHIGAN RESIDENTS ACCESS TO CURRENT SERVICES AND TRAINING SUPPORT THROUGH THEIR LIBRARIES; 3) OFFERING SUPPORT TO COMMUNITIES THROUGH COLLECTIVE IMPACT INITIATIVES AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT; AND 4) PROVIDING RESIDENTS WITH MICHIGAN?S HISTORICAL AND CULTURAL COLLECTIONS FOR LIFELONG LEARNING.

THE VIRGIN ISLANDS DEPARTMENT OF PLANNING AND NATURAL RESOURCES, THE ASSIGNED STATE LIBRARY ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCY FOR THE US. VIRGIN ISLANDS, WILL ESTABLISH A NEWSPAPER DIGITIZATION PROJECT AT BOTH ST. THOMAS AND ST. CROIX ISLANDS. THEY WILL DIGITIZE AND MAKE AVAILABLE ISLAND HISTORICAL AND CULTURAL DOCUMENT AND LOCAL NEWSPAPERS TO INCREASE ACCESS FOR THE PUBLIC.

ALELE MUSEUM, PUBLIC LIBRARY AND NATIONAL ARCHIVES, THE DESIGNATED STATE LIBRARY ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCY FOR THE REPUBLIC OF THE MARSHALL ISLANDS, WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT AN ONGOING INTERGENERATIONAL LIBRARY COMPUTER TRAINING PROGRAM. LIBRARY ASSISTANTS WILL BE PREPARED TO WORK WITH CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND WORKING ADULTS ON COMPUTER LITERACY. IN ADDITION, OLDER ADULTS WILL BE A PARTICULAR TARGET AUDIENCE FOR TRAINING THROUGH A PARTNERSHIP WITH A LOCAL RETIRED PERSONS ASSOCIATION. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO CONTINUE DIGITIZING OVER 600 VIDEO TAPES FROM THE YEARS WHEN ALELE WAS PRODUCING A WEEKLY TELEVISION PROGRAM OF HISTORIC AND CULTURAL EVENTS. GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO SUPPORT STAFF PARTICIPATION IN THE PACIFIC ISLANDS ASSOCIATION OF LIBRARIES, ARCHIVES, AND MUSEUMS (PIALA) CONFERENCE.

THE REPUBLIC OF PALAU WILL SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR LIBRARY STAFF THROUGH TRAVEL TO PROFESSIONAL CONFERENCES AUGMENTED AND SHARING KNOWLEDGE THROUGH A TRAIN-THE-TRAINER MODEL. TO HELP LIBRARY STAFF LEARN MORE ABOUT CONSERVATION AND DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, SELECTED LIBRARIANS WILL ATTEND PACIFIC ISLANDS ASSOCIATION OF LIBRARIES, ARCHIVES, AND MUSEUMS (PIALA) CONFERENCE, AND THEN TRAIN THEIR PEERS DURING A WEEK-LONG WORKSHOP. TO MAINTAIN IMPORTANT LIBRARY INFRASTRUCTURE, GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO SUPPORT A LICENSE FOR THREE SITES CONNECTED TO THE PALAU UNION CATALOG (PUC).

GUAM PUBLIC LIBRARY SYSTEM, WHICH SERVES THE TERRITORY'S ENTIRE ISLAND COMMUNITY, WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO UPGRADE THE REMAINING OLDER COMPUTERS TO NEW SYSTEMS. LIBRARY STAFF AND PATRONS WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED WITH SECURE AND RELIABLE ACCESS TO THE INTEGRATED LIBRARY SYSTEM.

THE FEDERATED STATES OF MICRONESIA WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE SUMMER READING PROGRAM AND RELATED SITE VISITS TO THREE OF ITS MAIN ISLANDS - CHUUK, KOSRAE AND YAP. THE PROGRAM WILL ENGAGE TWO GROUPS OF CHILDREN (K-4TH AND 5TH-8TH GRADES), WILL CONTINUE INCREASING THEIR LITERACY, AND WILL CONNECT THEM TO THE SERVICES AVAILABLE IN PUBLIC LIBRARIES. PROJECT LEADS WILL PARTNER WITH YAP PUBLIC LIBRARY, THE POHNPEI PUBLIC LIBRARY, THE CHUUK CHILDREN'S LIBRARY AND THE ROSE MACKWELUNG PUBLIC LIBRARY IN KOSRAE. GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO SUPPORT STAFF PARTICIPATION IN THE PACIFIC ISLANDS ASSOCIATION OF LIBRARIES, ARCHIVES, AND MUSEUMS (PIALA) CONFERENCE.

JOETEN KIYU PUBLIC LIBRARY, THE DESIGNATED STATE LIBRARY ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCY FOR THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS, WILL FUND BOOKMOBILE STAFF, COLLECTIONS, AND TECHNOLOGY TO SERVE YOUTH AND ADULTS IN REMOTE VILLAGES AROUND CNMI THAT MAY FACE TRANSPORTATION BARRIERS TO THE MAIN LIBRARY IN SAIPAN. THE PROJECT WILL BRING BOOKMOBILE SERVICES TO SCHOOLS, YOUTH CENTERS, THE LOCAL AGING CENTER, AND HEAD START CENTERS. THESE LIBRARY SERVICES WILL BRIDGE PRINT AND DIGITAL LITERACY EFFORTS AND EXTEND THE SUMMER READING PROGRAM TO OUTLYING AREAS, AS WELL AS EXTEND RESOURCES FROM THE NATIONAL LIBRARY FOR THE BLIND AND PHYSICALLY HANDICAPPED. GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO SUPPORT ONE STAFF MEMBER'S ATTENDANCE TO THE PACIFIC ISLANDS ASSOCIATION OF LIBRARIES, ARCHIVES, AND MUSEUMS (PIALA) CONFERENCE.

FELETI BARSTOW PUBLIC LIBRARY, THE DESIGNATED STATE LIBRARY ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCY FOR THE U.S. TERRITORY OF AMERICAN SAMOA, WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT A PROGRAMS VEHICLE TO ESTABLISH, MAINTAIN, AND IMPROVE SERVICES TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN AMERICAN SAMOA. THEY WILL INCREASE OUTREACH TO REMOTE COMMUNITIES THROUGH STAFF VISITS, IMPROVED MATERIAL DELIVERY AND INCREASE LITERACY TRAINING TO USERS.

THIS INCLUDES THE CYBRARIAN SUBSCRIPTION SERVICE FOR MANAGEMENT OF COMPUTER LABS, AS WELL AS BOOKMOBILE HOTSPOT DEVICES. TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH IN PERSON WORKSHOPS TO STRENGTHEN LIBRARY PROGRAM EXPERTISE.

FELETI BARSTOW PUBLIC LIBRARY, THE DESIGNATED STATE LIBRARY ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCY FOR THE U.S. TERRITORY OF AMERICAN SAMOA, WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE POLYNESIAN PHOTO ARCHIVES, A DIGITAL REPOSITORY OF VISUAL IMAGES OF HISTORIC SAMOAN CULTURE AND TRADITIONS. THE PROJECT WILL PRESERVE AND MAKE ACCESSIBLE ARCHIVAL MATERIALS THAT ARE HISTORICALLY AND CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT TO THE SAMOAN ISLANDS AND POLYNESIA, DATING FROM THE 1840S TO THE PRESENT. GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT CONTINUED EFFORTS TO PROCESS AND DIGITIZE THIS COLLECTION, AND VARIOUS METHODS OF CROWDSOURCING FROM LOCAL STUDENTS, SCHOLARS, HISTORIANS AND ELDERS WILL BE UTILIZED TO COLLECT METADATA.

THE FEDERATED STATES OF MICRONESIA WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE SUMMER READING PROGRAM AND RELATED SITE VISITS TO THREE OF ITS MAIN ISLANDS - CHUUK, KOSRAE AND YAP. THE PROGRAM WILL ENGAGE TWO GROUPS OF CHILDREN (K-4TH AND 5TH-8TH GRADES), WILL CONTINUE INCREASING THEIR LITERACY, AND WILL CONNECT THEM TO THE SERVICES AVAILABLE IN PUBLIC LIBRARIES. PROJECT LEADS WILL PARTNER WITH YAP PUBLIC LIBRARY, THE POHNPEI PUBLIC LIBRARY, THE CHUUK CHILDREN'S LIBRARY AND THE ROSE MACKWELUNG PUBLIC LIBRARY IN KOSRAE. GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO SUPPORT STAFF PARTICIPATION IN THE PACIFIC ISLANDS ASSOCIATION OF LIBRARIES, ARCHIVES, AND MUSEUMS (PIALA) CONFERENCE AND THE BIANNUAL PACIFIC WORKSHOP ORGANIZED BY IMLS.

GUAM PUBLIC LIBRARY SYSTEM, WHICH SERVES THE TERRITORY'S ENTIRE ISLAND COMMUNITY, WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT DIGITIZATION AND PRESERVATION OF IMPORTANT HISTORICAL MATERIALS. THE LIBRARY'S COLLECTION INCLUDES A RANGE OF GOVERNMENT DOCUMENTS, REGIONAL NEWSPAPERS DATING BACK TO THE 1940S, AS WELL AS IMAGES OF HISTORIC INTEREST TO USERS. THE PROJECT WILL DIGITIZE THESE MATERIALS FOR CONTINUED ACCESS BY STAFF AND PATRONS, AS WELL AS PRESERVE THE ORIGINALS. GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES FOR THE SCANNING AND PRESERVATION ASPECTS OF THE PROJECT, WHICH ARE NEW TO THE LIBRARY. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO FUND STAFF TO ATTEND THE BIANNUAL PACIFIC WORKSHOP ORGANIZED BY IMLS.

JOETEN KIYU PUBLIC LIBRARY, THE DESIGNATED STATE LIBRARY ADMINISTRATIVE AGENCY FOR THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS, WILL FUND BOOKMOBILE STAFF, COLLECTIONS, AND TECHNOLOGY TO SERVE YOUTH IN REMOTE VILLAGES AS WELL AS OLDER ADULTS. THESE GROUPS REPRESENT THE LARGEST NUMBER OF NATIVE SPEAKERS WITH LIMITED ENGLISH ABILITIES AND FACE TRANSPORTATION BARRIERS TO THE MAIN LIBRARY IN SAIPAN. THE PROJECT WILL BRING BOOKMOBILE SERVICES TO SCHOOLS, YOUTH CENTERS, THE LOCAL AGING CENTER, AND HEAD START CENTERS. THESE LIBRARY SERVICES WILL BRIDGE PRINT AND DIGITAL LITERACY EFFORTS AND EXTEND THE SUMMER READING PROGRAM TO OUTLYING AREAS. GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO SUPPORT STAFF PARTICIPATION IN THE PACIFIC ISLANDS ASSOCIATION OF LIBRARIES, ARCHIVES, AND MUSEUMS (PIALA) CONFERENCE AND THE BIANNUAL PACIFIC WORKSHOP ORGANIZED BY IMLS.
